item.title: Charles Leclerc
item.description: "For Tonio." Charles Leclerc took his first win in 2019 at Spa, in the wake of the heartbreaking loss of Anthoine Hubert in a crash earlier that weekend, and dedicated his victory to his late friend. I felt this moment, originally captured by a Ferrari hired photographer, captured the intense emotions that Leclerc must have been feeling as he climbed out of his Ferrari after the race.

item.title: Chasing Cars (Cover) - Snow Patrol
item.description: Your browser does not support the audio element. A much more low effort cover than my previous (expect more of this - I’m lazy). Sometimes it’s nice to just grab a guitar and try a rendition of a song you haven’t heard in years, Chasing Cars came out whilst I was in my early teens and I remember it doing the rounds at school on the twenty(ish) songs worth of storage mp3 players at the time.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there! I go by Hecrer and I usually work as a Software Engineer, but this site is a place for my music and doodles and maybe a few other things too. I hope you have a good time here!

item.title: Chapel Song (Cover) - Augustines
item.description: Your browser does not support the audio element. My take on Chapel Song, the first track on the album Rise Ye Sunken Ships by Augustines. I first saw this song on a live Cardinal Session on YouTube, and it’s been one of my favourite songs to play since.

item.title: Valtteri Bottas
item.description: "Valtteri, it's James." I’ve been working on some art for a new project that expands the service our Server Manager provides for Assetto Corsa. Here’s Bottas. This was my first time using an iPad (the iPad Pro 2018, that I borrowed) to draw something, and i’m pretty happy with how it came out! Mixing the “real” feeling of using a traditional pencil directly onto a drawing surface with all of the added benefits that come with working in art software really does create a powerful and unique experience.
